abstract: Despite deals with Chinese partners, the automaker's owner said that it was unable to pay employees their June salaries, and prospects for obtaining short-term funding were uncertain.
snippet: Despite deals with Chinese partners, the automaker's owner said that it was unable to pay employees their June salaries, and prospects for obtaining short-term funding were uncertain.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Saab on Thursday found itself facing a possible collapse after the automaker’s Dutch owner said that it was unable to pay employees their salaries for June and warned that the prospects of obtaining short-term financing were uncertain.

headline.print_headline: Saab Unable To Pay Wages As Financing Looks Hazy
